abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is satisfactory,
            sustainability likely, and institutional development impacts
            substantial, with satisfactory performances by both the
            Bank, and Borrower. Lessons drawn from the project suggest
            that given uncertain political environments, Technical
            Assistance (TA) projects should provide enough flexibility,
            and be adequately supervised to withstand adversity, and
            respond to changing circumstances. These factors were
            critical in ensuring the project's successful
            achievement of objectives. Furthermore, beneficiaries should
            have sufficient capacity to ensure the transfer of necessary
            skills, otherwise, training programs should be tailored
            according to circumstances, and involve technical expertise
            in curriculum design. Again, this not only ensured the
            responsiveness of training programs to TA, but the adequate
            transfer of knowledge, as well. The project also confirms
            that capacity building is a long-term undertaking,
            particularly in evolving situations, as ownership of reforms
            implies allowing for sufficient time to build consensus on
            policy, and procedural changes for reforms to be
            successfully sustainable. The strong Project Management
            Unit's capacity in Bank procurement guidelines, and
            disbursement procedures, proved essential to the successful
            project results, in an otherwise difficult situation, given
            the weak institutional capacity, and political constraints.
            Finally, TA projects can be instrumental in assisting in the
            post-conflict restoration of public administration services,
            evidenced by the project's re-establishment of
            budgetary systems.
